Field Detail

mutationProbVarFactor

private double mutationProbVarFactor
The decreasing factor by which the mutationProbability value is decreased in each iteration. The default value is 1.0 which implies that mutationProbability value doesn't decrease. To set this value setVariableMutationProbability(double) should be used.

mutationProbability

private double mutationProbability
The current probability of a mutation occurring

probToRankFactor

private double probToRankFactor
The factor to be used to calculate the probability of a state being chosen based on it's ranking

diversityUsageFactor

private double diversityUsageFactor
A number between 0 and 1 that represents the factor by which the diversity is to be multiplied to calculate the ultimate value of a state. A value of 1 means that fitness will be totally discarded and diversity used instead. A value of 0 means that only fitness will be used

directFitnessToProbability

private boolean directFitnessToProbability
A boolean that states whether a direct translation of fitness to probability is to be used or on the other hand a ranking method. for more detailed information see documentation of enableFitnessToRank(double) and enableDirectMethod().

statesToPair

int statesToPair
The number of states to be paired in each iteration

population

Population population
The Population We are dealing with

Constructor Detail

GeneticRandomGenerator

public GeneticRandomGenerator(Population pop,
                              int statesToPair,
                              double mutationProb)
A simple constructor.

Parameters:
pop - the Population to whom this GeneticRandomGenerator is link
statesToPair - the number of states to pair
mutationProb - the initial mutation probability
Method Detail

statesForReproduction

public State[] statesForReproduction()
A method that returns the states to be paired for the next generation. It selects the method to select the states based on the current setting

Returns:
an array withTheStatesForNextGeneration

statesForReproduction_Fitness_To_Rank

private State[] statesForReproduction_Fitness_To_Rank()
A method that returns the states for reproduction using the method fitness to rank.

Returns:
the states to be used in reproduction

statesForReproduction_Direct_Fitness_To_Probability

public State[] statesForReproduction_Direct_Fitness_To_Probability()
A method that returns the states for reproduction using the method directFitnessToProbability.

Returns:
the states to be used in reproduction

segmentsOfState

public java.lang.Integer[] segmentsOfState(State state)
A method that returns the index of the segments of the choromosome of a given state to be passed along to his first descendant

Parameters:
state - the state whose chromosome is to be passed to his descendant
Returns:
the zero based index of the chromosome segments to be passed along to the passed state's first descendant

statesForNextGen

public State[] statesForNextGen()

stateShouldMutate

boolean stateShouldMutate(State s)
A function return a value that is intended to make a state mutate or not. The best state is never mutated.

Returns:
a boolean stating if a state should mutate

mutatingSegmentForState

int mutatingSegmentForState(State s)

BubbleSort

public static void BubbleSort(State[] states,
                              int nrStatesToOrder,
                              double diversityFactor)
This method is used to put at the head of the array a given number of the most fit states. Useful since most times not the hole array needs to be sorted

Parameters:
states - all the states
nrStatesToOrder - the number of states to be guaranteed to be at the head of the array

updateParameters

public void updateParameters()
A method to be called at each iteration. It updates the parameters necessary for algorithm to update. This method should be explicitly called at the end of each iteration

enableDirectMethod

public void enableDirectMethod()
A method that defines the way to translate a state's fitness to probability of being chosen for reproduction and/or selection for the next generation as a direct method. Meaning the likeliness of a state being chosen is directly proportional to his fitness. This is the default behaviour.

enableFitnessToRank

public void enableFitnessToRank(double rankProb)
A method that defines the way to translate a state's fitness to probability of being chosen for reproduction and/or selection for the next generation as a direct method. Meaning the likeliness of a state being chosen is (1-rankProb)^n for the nth state with the best fitness.

Parameters:
rankProb - the parameter to be used for calculating the probability of a state being chosen according to the formula presented above.

enableFitnessAndDiversity

public void enableFitnessAndDiversity(boolean enable)
A method that enables or disables the usage of diversity as a method to calculate likelihood of a state to pass along to the next generation or to reproduce itself. By default diversity is not used

Parameters:
enable - a boolean that states whether diversity is to be used or not.

setVariableMutationProbability

public void setVariableMutationProbability(double factor)
A method that sets the increment/decrement factor for mutationProbability. Change in mutationProbability as well as other variable parameters will only occur after a call to updateParameters().

Parameters:
factor - the factor by which mutationProbability should be multiplied at each cycle. This number shouldn't be negative.A value smaller than 1 means that mutationProbability will decrease over time.A value bigger than 1 means that mutationProbability will increase over time.
